'''Sealeo''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''トドグラー''' ''Todoggler'') is a dual-type {{2t|Ice|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Spheal}} starting at [[level]] 32 and evolves into {{p|Walrein}} starting at level 44.

==Biology==
Sealeo is a bright blue, pinniped Pokémon. Its throat and chest are beige with speckling around the edges. There are two short tusks protruding from its upper jaw, and it has dark brown, oval eyes. It has a powerful pair of front flippers, which are able to crush ice. Additionally, it has a short, flipper-like tail. On the sides of its blunt muzzle are thick, white whiskers. When it encounters new objects, they are placed on its nose and rolled around to test its smell and texture. It has also been known to roll {{p|Spheal}} on its nose. Sealeo is capable of coating its body in ice and rolling to use its former [[signature move]], {{m|Ice Ball}}. This Pokémon lives in the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Sea Pokémon|sea}}, and dives underwater to hunt for prey five times a day.

==In the anime==
[[File:PSA Sealeo.png|thumb|250px|left|Sealeo in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Sealeo debuted alongside its pre-evolution at the [[Oceanic Museum]] in [[Slateport City]] in ''[[AG036|The Spheal of Approval]]''. It was owned by [[Captain Stern]], who sent it out to battle [[Team Magma]] and their three {{p|Mightyena}}.

The {{ci|Sootopolis}} [[Gym Leader]] [[Juan]] used a Sealeo in his [[Gym]] {{pkmn|battle}} against {{Ash}} in ''[[AG110|The Great Eight Fate!]]''. Sealeo battled against {{AP|Snorunt}} and {{AP|Pikachu}} alongside {{p|Seaking}} and managed to defeat {{p|Snorunt}} but were defeated by {{p|Pikachu}} and {{AP|Corphish}}.

A Sealeo appeared in ''[[DP089|Up Close and Personable!]]''. [[Angie]] stumbled upon it with Ash and decided to draw Sealeo.

===Minor appearances===
A large group of Sealeo, Spheal, and {{p|Walrein}} appeared in ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Sealeo appeared in ''[[DP027|Settling a Not-So-Old Score!]]'', where it was participating in the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the {{to|Floaroma}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Sealeo appeared in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Wallace Richard.png|thumb|110px|Sealeo in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS223|I More Than Like You, Luvdisc I]]'', a Sealeo named Richard is part of [[Wallace]]'s team. Like his Trainer and the rest of his team, he is competent at both {{pkmn|battle}}s and {{pkmn|Contest}}s.

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* {{g|Pinball: Ruby & Sapphire}}: Sealeo stars in the Bonus Field {{p|Whiscash}} or {{p|Pelipper}} takes the player to. They will bounce the Poké Ball or a {{p|Spheal}} into the basket to earn the points of the round. Hitting a Sealeo while it is bouncing a Spheal will cause it to drop the Pokémon and miss out on the points for it.

==Trivia==
===Origin===
Sealeo is based on an {{wp|earless seal}}.

====Name origin====
Sealeo is a combination of ''sea'' or ''seal'' and ''leo'' (Latin for ''lion'', referring to a seal's relation to {{wp|sea lion}}s).

Todoggler may be a combination of 胡獱 ''todo'' (sea lion) and ''juggler''.
